title: A bill to reduce deaths occurring from overdoses of drugs or controlled substances.
content: Drug Overdose Reduction Act - Requires the Director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) to award grants or cooperative agreements to enable public health agencies or community-based organizations to reduce deaths occurring from overdoses of drugs or controlled substances, including by: (1) providing training on the effective response to individuals who have overdosed. Or (2) providing overdose prevention, recognition, treatment, or response to individuals in need of such services. Requires the Director to: (1) annually compile and publish data on the deaths occurring from overdoses of drugs or controlled substances for the preceding year. And (2) develop a plan to reduce the number of such deaths.
